thread.title: Neiman Marcus Files to Go Public Less Than Two Years After Sale
thread.title_full: Neiman Marcus Files to Go Public Less Than Two Years After Sale - Bloomberg Business

author: Leslie Picker
title: Neiman Marcus Files to Go Public Less Than Two Years After Sale
text:
Neiman Marcus Group Inc., the luxury department-store chain, filed for an initial public offering.
The company, bought in 2013 by Ares Management LLC and the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board for $6 billion, filed with a $100 million placeholder, an amount used to calculate registration fees that may change.
Neiman Marcus plans to use proceeds from the IPO to repay debt. The company posted $4.8 billion in revenue last year, according to a regulatory filing Tuesday. Women account for 79 percent of its customer base, the filing shows.
The retailer previously filed to go public in June 2013, before owners TPG and Warburg Pincus sold it.
Neiman Marcus, based in Dallas, didnâ€™t list any underwriters in the filing Tuesday.
